<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 119, 380, 147]]<|/det|> Cambridge IGCSE™ <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 185]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 165, 236]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 213, 424, 261]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[632, 220, 722, 236]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[73, 257, 909, 276]]<|/det|>
ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS
0606/22
Paper 2
May/June 2025
2 hours
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 355, 396, 372]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 384, 361, 399]]<|/det|> No additional materials are needed. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 419, 225, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 431, 294, 458]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 460, 808, 477]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 493, 482, 508]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 525, 554, 543]]<|/det|> - You should use a scientific calculator where appropriate. - You must show all necessary working clearly. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 556, 856, 573]]<|/det|> - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 585, 487, 602]]<|/det|> - For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 632, 214, 647]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 648, 388, 665]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 80. - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 74, 567, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 105, 477, 124]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[601, 103, 785, 126]]<|/det|>
\[
(x-a)^{2}+(y-b)^{2}=r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 157, 537, 174]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 157, 678, 173]]<|/det|>
\[
A=\pi r l
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 205, 372, 220]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 201, 686, 220]]<|/det|>
\[
A=4 \pi r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 246, 680, 275]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{1}{3} A h
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 292, 686, 322]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 206, 372, 220]]<|/det|>
 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 255, 496, 272]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 300, 336, 317]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 349, 234, 364]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 345, 656, 364]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2}+b x+c=0\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 367, 559, 404]]<|/det|>
\[
x=\frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 449, 225, 464]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 437, 907, 526]]<|/det|>
\[
(a+b)^{n}=a^{n}+\binom{n}{1} a^{n-1} b+\binom{n}{2} a^{n-2} b^{2}+\ldots+\binom{n}{r} a^{n-r} b^{r}+\ldots+b^{n},
\quad \text { where } n \text { is a positive integer and } \binom{n}{r}=\frac{n !}{(n-r) ! r !}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 554, 217, 569]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[388, 552, 669, 601]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& u_{n}=a+(n-1) d \\
& S_{n}=\frac{1}{2} n(a+l)=\frac{1}{2} n\{2 a+(n-1) d\}
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 634, 217, 649]]<|/det|>
Geometric series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[388, 630, 572, 710]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& u_{n}=a r^{n-1} \\
& S_{n}=\frac{a(1-r^{n})}{1-r} \quad(r \neq 1) \\
& S_{\infty}=\frac{a}{1-r} \quad(|r|<1)
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 741, 157, 754]]<|/det|>
Identities

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[388, 736, 556, 790]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \sin ^{2} A+\cos ^{2} A=1 \\
& \sec ^{2} A=1+\tan ^{2} A \\
& \operatorname{cosec}^{2} A=1+\cot ^{2} A
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 829, 239, 846]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta A B C\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[388, 823, 576, 901]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \frac{a}{\sin A}=\frac{b}{\sin B}=\frac{c}{\sin C} \\
& a^{2}=b^{2}+c^{2}-2 b c \cos A \\
& \Delta=\frac{1}{2} a b \sin C
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 616, 91]]<|/det|>
2 In this question，all lengths are in metres and time is in seconds．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line such that its displacement \(s\) from a fixed point \(O\) at time \(t\) is given by \(\quad s=(t-4)^{2}(t-1)\) for \(t \geqslant 0\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 151, 857, 168]]<|/det|>
（a）On the axes，sketch the displacement－time graph of \(P\) ，stating the intercepts with the axes．

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[99, 183, 901, 524]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 540, 493, 557]]<|/det|>
（b）Find an expression for the velocity，\(v\) ，of \(P\) ． Give your answer in a factorised form．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 819, 91]]<|/det|>
(c) On the axes, sketch the velocity-time graph of \(P\), stating the intercepts with the axes.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 105, 910, 426]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 443, 527, 462]]<|/det|>
(d) Find an expression for the acceleration, \(a\), of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 550, 848, 567]]<|/det|>
(e) On the axes, sketch the acceleration-time graph of \(P\), stating the intercepts with the axes.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 581, 908, 904]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 361, 91]]<|/det|>
3 Functions \(f\) and \(g\) are such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[353, 103, 570, 161]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \mathrm{f}(x)=\frac{3 x}{x+4} \text { for } x>0 \\
& \mathrm{~g}(x)=\sqrt{x+2} \text { for } x>-2
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 175, 358, 192]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\operatorname{fg}(x)=1\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 680, 107]]<|/det|>
4 (a) Given that \(y=4 \sin 2 x \cos 2 x\), find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}\) when \(x=\frac{\pi}{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 409, 485, 426]]<|/det|>
(b) A curve has equation \(y=4 \sin 2 x \cos 2 x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 435, 788, 462]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve at the point where \(x=\frac{\pi}{6}\) meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 470, 407, 485]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 750, 91]]<|/det|>
5 (a) A 4-digit number is to be formed using the digits \(0,2,4,5,6\) and 8 . The 4 -digit number must not start with 0 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 105, 609, 122]]<|/det|>
Any digit may be used at most once in the 4 -digit number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 135, 567, 153]]<|/det|>
(i) Find how many 4 -digit numbers can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 213, 609, 230]]<|/det|>
(ii) Find how many even 4 -digit numbers can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 351, 738, 368]]<|/det|>
(iii) Find how many 4 -digit numbers that are divisible by 5 can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 534, 616, 555]]<|/det|>
(b) Solve the equation \((n+1) \times{ }^{n+1} \mathrm{C}_{12}=33(n-10) \times{ }^{n} \mathrm{C}_{10}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 76, 700, 95]]<|/det|>
6 The volume, \(V\), of a sphere is increasing at the constant rate of \(2 \pi \mathrm{~cm}^{3} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\). Find the rate of change of the surface area, \(S\), of this sphere when the volume of the sphere is \(36 \pi \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 637, 91]]<|/det|>
7 The first three terms of an arithmetic progression can be written as

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[240, 98, 465, 124]]<|/det|>
\[
2 \ln \left(x^{3}\right), \quad 5 \ln \left(x^{2}\right), \quad 2 \ln \left(x^{7}\right) .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 918, 153]]<|/det|>
(a) Given that \(x>1\), find the least number of terms for the sum of this progression to be greater than \(43 \ln \left(x^{24}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 816, 91]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that the 25 th term of this progression is equal to 408 , find the exact value of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 97, 90]]<|/det|>
8

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[99, 90, 901, 404]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 421, 523, 454]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y=\frac{15}{x}-\frac{5}{x^{2}}\). The curve meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 474, 440, 491]]<|/det|>
The curve has a maximum at the point \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 521, 686, 538]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(A B\) and the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 552, 372, 569]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 76, 465, 91]]<|/det|>
Continuation of working space for Question 8.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 680, 95]]<|/det|>
9 （a）Solve the equation \(3 \sec 3 x=\sqrt{3} \operatorname{cosec} 3 x\) for \(-120^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 120^{\circ}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[334, 839, 664, 856]]<|/det|>
Question 10 is printed on the next page．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 76, 918, 114]]<|/det|>
10 The first three terms, in descending powers of \(x\), in the expansion of \(\left(3 x^{2}-a\right)^{n}\left(1+\frac{1}{x^{2}}\right)^{2}\) can be
written as \(729 x^{12}+972 x^{10}+b x^{8}\), where \(a, b\) and \(n\) are constants. written as \(\quad 729 x^{12}+972 x^{10}+b x^{8}\), where \(a, b\) and \(n\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 347, 151]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a, b\) and \(n\).
